articles.headline: Impeachment Investigators Exploring Whether Trump Lied to Mueller
articles.snippet: As part of the Russia inquiry, President Trump had given written answers to questions from Robert S. Mueller III.
articles.abstract: As part of the Russia inquiry, President Trump had given written answers to questions from Robert S. Mueller III.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House Democrats are exploring whether President Trump lied in his written answers to Robert S. Mueller III’s investigation, a lawyer for the House told a federal appeals court on Monday, raising the prospect of an additional basis for an article of impeachment.

articles.headline: Trump’s Made-for-TV Trade War Keeps World Guessing
articles.snippet: The president’s unpredictability and demands of China are complicating an end to the long-running dispute, experts say.
articles.abstract: The president’s unpredictability and demands of China are complicating an end to the long-running dispute, experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: When President Trump’s advisers suggested that Beijing resume buying around $20 billion in American farm products as part of a trade deal, Mr. Trump wasn’t satisfied. In a dramatic public retelling in the Cabinet Room, he said he pressed his team to more than triple that figure, then trimmed that a little and asked for up to $50 billion in annual purchases.

articles.headline: In Shift, U.S. Says Israeli Settlements in West Bank Do Not Violate International Law
articles.snippet: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced the reversal of decades of American policy that may doom any peace efforts.
articles.abstract: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced the reversal of decades of American policy that may doom any peace efforts.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration declared on Monday that the United States does not consider Israeli settlements in the West Bank a violation of international law, reversing four decades of American policy and removing what has been an important barrier to annexation of Palestinian territory.
articles.byline: By Lara Jakes and David M. Halbfinger

articles.headline: Big Tech’s Toughest Opponent Says She’s Just Getting Started
articles.snippet: Margrethe Vestager won praise for her oversight of the tech industry. Now, with more authority from the European Union, she envisions a more aggressive agenda.
articles.abstract: Margrethe Vestager won praise for her oversight of the tech industry. Now, with more authority from the European Union, she envisions a more aggressive agenda.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Margrethe Vestager spent the past five years developing a well-earned reputation as the world’s top tech industry watchdog. From her perch overseeing Europe’s competition rules, she fined Google more than $9 billion for breaking antitrust laws, and forced Apple to pay about $14.5 billion for dodging taxes.
articles.byline: By Adam Satariano and Matina Stevis-Gridneff

articles.headline: The Divide in Yakima Is the Divide in America
articles.snippet: What the changing demographics of this country look like up close.
articles.abstract: What the changing demographics of this country look like up close.
articles.lead_paragraph: YAKIMA, Wash. — Dulce Gutiérrez heard the angry voice as she was speaking in Spanish to a group of students who had volunteered to hand out leaflets for her City Council campaign.
articles.byline: By Dionne Searcey, Robert Gebeloff and Mason Trinca

articles.headline: Parents of Besieged Hong Kong Protesters Come to the Front Lines
articles.snippet: The parents of young people under siege at a university emerged as a call for compromise.
articles.abstract: The parents of young people under siege at a university emerged as a call for compromise.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — One mother fell to her knees before riot police officers and begged for her daughter’s release. Another promised she would boil soup for a trapped son before he made a desperate escape across police lines. From a distance, a father got his first glimpse of his son in days — as the son was led away in handcuffs.
articles.byline: By Tiffany May and Paul Mozur
